Detailed Description

A Widget that shows items in a vertically scrolling two-level list.

This differs from the ListWidget by allowing two levels: groups which can individually be expanded to show its children. The items come from the IExpandableListProvider associated with this Widget.

Expandable lists are able to show an indicator beside each item to display the item's current state (the states are usually one of expanded group, collapsed group, child, or last child). Use setChildIndicator(Drawer) or setGroupIndicator(Drawer) (or the corresponding XML attributes) to set these indicators (see the docs for each method to see additional state that each Drawer can have). The default style for an ExpandableListWidget provides indicators which will be shown next to Widgets given to the ExpandableListWidget. The layouts android.R.layout.simple_expandable_list_item_1 and android.R.layout.simple_expandable_list_item_2 (which should be used with android.widget.SimpleCursorTreeProvider) contain the preferred position information for indicators.

The context menu information set by an ExpandableListWidget will be a ExpandableListContextMenuInfo object with ExpandableListContextMenuInfo#packedPosition being a packed position that can be used with getPackedPositionType(long) and the other similar methods.

Note: You cannot use the value wrap_content for the android:layout_height attribute of a ExpandableListWidget in XML if the parent's size is also not strictly specified (for example, if the parent were ScrollWidget you could not specify wrap_content since it also can be any length. However, you can use wrap_content if the ExpandableListWidget parent has a specific size, such as 100 pixels.

ref android.R.styleable::ExpandableListWidget_groupIndicator ref android.R.styleable::ExpandableListWidget_indicatorLeft ref android.R.styleable::ExpandableListWidget_indicatorRight ref android.R.styleable::ExpandableListWidget_childIndicator ref android.R.styleable::ExpandableListWidget_childIndicatorLeft ref android.R.styleable::ExpandableListWidget_childIndicatorRight ref android.R.styleable::ExpandableListWidget_childDivider

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
Enumerator:
PACKED_POSITION_TYPE_GROUP 

The packed position represents a group.

PACKED_POSITION_TYPE_CHILD 

The packed position represents a child.

PACKED_POSITION_TYPE_NULL 

The packed position represents a neither/null/no preference.

CHILD_INDICATOR_INHERIT 

Denotes when a child indicator should inherit this bound from the generic indicator bounds.

PACKED_POSITION_VALUE_NULL 

The value for a packed position that represents neither/null/no preference.

This value is not otherwise possible since a group type (first bit 0) should not have a child position filled.

Definition at line 96 of file ExpandableListWidget.h.

gaia::graphics::Drawer* gaia::ui::ExpandableListWidget::getChildIndicator ( )
virtual int64_t gaia::ui::ExpandableListWidget::getExpandableListPosition ( int32_t  flatListPosition) [virtual]

Converts a flat list position (the raw position of an item (child or group) in the list) to an group and/or child position (represented in a packed position).

This is useful in situations where the caller needs to use the underlying ListWidget's methods. Use ExpandableListWidget#getPackedPositionType , ExpandableListWidget#getPackedPositionChild, ExpandableListWidget#getPackedPositionGroup to unpack.

Parameters:
flatListPositionThe flat list position to be converted.
Returns:
The group and/or child position for the given flat list position in packed position representation. PACKED_POSITION_VALUE_NULL if the position corresponds to a header or a footer item.
virtual IExpandableListProvider* gaia::ui::ExpandableListWidget::getExpandableListProvider ( ) [virtual]

Gets the Provider that provides data to this Widget.

Returns:
The Provider that provides data to this Widget.
virtual int32_t gaia::ui::ExpandableListWidget::getFlatListPosition ( int64_t  packedPosition) [virtual]

Converts a group and/or child position to a flat list position.

This is useful in situations where the caller needs to use the underlying ListWidget's methods.

Parameters:
packedPositionThe group and/or child positions to be converted in packed position representation. Use getPackedPositionForChild(int32_t, int32_t) or getPackedPositionForGroup(int32_t).
Returns:
The flat list position for the given child or group.
gaia::graphics::Drawer* gaia::ui::ExpandableListWidget::getGroupIndicator ( )
static int32_t gaia::ui::ExpandableListWidget::getPackedPositionChild ( int64_t  packedPosition) [static]

Gets the child position from a packed position that is of PACKED_POSITION_TYPE_CHILD type (use getPackedPositionType(long)).

To get the group that this child belongs to, use getPackedPositionGroup(long). See getPackedPositionForChild(int32_t, int32_t).

Parameters:
packedPositionThe packed position from which the child position will be returned.
Returns:
The child position portion of the packed position. If this does not contain a child, returns -1.
static int64_t gaia::ui::ExpandableListWidget::getPackedPositionForChild ( int32_t  groupPosition,
int32_t  childPosition 
) [static]

Returns the packed position representation of a child's position.

In general, a packed position should be used in situations where the position given to/returned from an IExpandableListProvider or ExpandableListWidget method can either be a child or group. The two positions are packed into a single long which can be unpacked using getPackedPositionChild(long), getPackedPositionGroup(long), and getPackedPositionType(long).

Parameters:
groupPositionThe child's parent group's position.
childPositionThe child position within the group.
Returns:
The packed position representation of the child (and parent group).
static int64_t gaia::ui::ExpandableListWidget::getPackedPositionForGroup ( int32_t  groupPosition) [static]

Returns the packed position representation of a group's position.

See getPackedPositionForChild(int32_t, int32_t).

Parameters:
groupPositionThe child's parent group's position.
Returns:
The packed position representation of the group.
static int32_t gaia::ui::ExpandableListWidget::getPackedPositionGroup ( int64_t  packedPosition) [static]

Gets the group position from a packed position.

See getPackedPositionForChild(int32_t, int32_t).

Parameters:
packedPositionThe packed position from which the group position will be returned.
Returns:
The group position portion of the packed position. If this does not contain a group, returns -1.
static int32_t gaia::ui::ExpandableListWidget::getPackedPositionType ( int64_t  packedPosition) [static]

Gets the type of a packed position.

See getPackedPositionForChild(int32_t, int32_t).

Parameters:
packedPositionThe packed position for which to return the type.
Returns:
The type of the position contained within the packed position, either PACKED_POSITION_TYPE_CHILD, PACKED_POSITION_TYPE_GROUP, or PACKED_POSITION_TYPE_NULL.
virtual int64_t gaia::ui::ExpandableListWidget::getSelectedId ( ) [virtual]

Gets the ID of the currently selected group or child.

Can return -1 if no selection.

Returns:
The ID of the currently selected group or child. -1 if no selection.
virtual int64_t gaia::ui::ExpandableListWidget::getSelectedPosition ( ) [virtual]

Gets the position of the currently selected group or child (along with its type).

Can return PACKED_POSITION_VALUE_NULL if no selection.

Returns:
A packed position containing the currently selected group or child's position and type. PACKED_POSITION_VALUE_NULL if no selection or if selection is on a header or a footer item.

Returns:
Whether the group is currently expanded.
virtual void gaia::ui::ExpandableListWidget::setChildDivider ( gaia::graphics::Drawer *  childDivider) [virtual]

Sets the Drawer that will be drawn adjacent to every child in the list.

This will be drawn using the same height as the normal divider (setDivider(Drawer)) or if it does not have an intrinsic height, the height set by setDividerHeight(int32_t).

Parameters:
childDividerThe Drawer to use.
virtual void gaia::ui::ExpandableListWidget::setChildIndicator ( gaia::graphics::Drawer *  childIndicator) [virtual]

Sets the indicator to be drawn next to a child.

Parameters:
childIndicatorThe Drawer to be used as an indicator. If the child is the last child for a group, the state android.R.attr#state_last will be set.
virtual void gaia::ui::ExpandableListWidget::setChildIndicatorBounds ( int32_t  left,
int32_t  right 
) [virtual]

Sets the drawing bounds for the child indicator.

For either, you can specify CHILD_INDICATOR_INHERIT to use inherit from the general indicator's bounds.

See also:
setIndicatorBounds(int32_t, int32_t)
Parameters:
leftThe left position (relative to the left bounds of this Widget) to start drawing the indicator.
rightThe right position (relative to the left bounds of this Widget) to end the drawing of the indicator.

virtual bool gaia::ui::ExpandableListWidget::setSelectedChild ( int32_t  groupPosition,
int32_t  childPosition,
bool  shouldExpandGroup 
) [virtual]

Sets the selection to the specified child.

If the child is in a collapsed group, the group will only be expanded and child subsequently selected if shouldExpandGroup is set to true, otherwise the method will return false.

Parameters:
groupPositionThe position of the group that contains the child.
childPositionThe position of the child within the group.
shouldExpandGroupWhether the child's group should be expanded if it is collapsed.
Returns:
Whether the selection was successfully set on the child.
virtual void gaia::ui::ExpandableListWidget::setSelectedGroup ( int32_t  groupPosition) [virtual]

Sets the selection to the specified group.

Parameters:
groupPositionThe position of the group that should be selected.
